name.baseName: Extraction Stage ; Oil ; Reservoir Extraction, Treatment, and Separation
开采阶段;石油;油藏提取处理分离

dataSetInformation.common:generalComment: This process pertains to the extraction, treatment, and separation of oil in the Permian Basin, specifically from the San Andres dolomite. It is utilized in the petroleum industry for enhanced oil recovery operations, including waterflooding and CO2 injection at depths typical for this region, with associated gas processing for component separation and CO2 re-injection for long-term storage.
该过程涉及二叠纪盆地、特别是圣安德烈斯白云岩的石油提取、处理与分离。它在石油行业中用于增强油气回收操作，包括在该地区典型深度的注水和二氧化碳注入，以及伴生气体处理以用于组分分离和长期储存的二氧化碳再注入。

locationOfOperationSupplyOrProduction.descriptionOfRestrictions: the Permian Basin of West Texas,Although all emissions and discharges should be included in a full LCA, this study focused on greenhouse gas emissions (CO2, CH4, and N2O) only. The analysis was limited to the boundary of the facility and included the extraction of the oil and associated gas from the oil reservoir, the processing of the associated gas for separation of the different components (water, hydrogen sulfide -H2S, CO2, CH4, natural gas liquids), the compression of the separated CO2 stream destined for injection, and the transport and injection of the CO2 in the oil reservoir for extraction of additional oil and for long-term storage. Figure 1 shows a schematic of this process. The extraction and transport of the CO2 from the natural reservoir is not part of the analysis.The reservoir we investigated in this study is situated in the Permian Basin of West Texas. It is a layered dolomite with an average porosity of 8.5% and an average permeability of 1.5 md. Production is from the San Andres dolomite at an average depth of 1585 m, and the thickness of the producing layer varies from 15 to 70 m. The unit contains 13 130 producing acres, which have already undergone waterflooding and are now under enhanced oil recovery production using CO2. The minimum miscibility pressure to be maintained for injection of CO2 is 85 atm
德克萨斯州西部的二叠纪盆地,这是一种层状白云岩，平均孔隙度为8.5%，平均渗透率为1.5 md。产层来自圣安德烈斯白云岩，平均深度为1585 m，产层厚度为15 ~ 70 m。该单元占地13130英亩，已经进行了水驱，

technology.technologyDescriptionAndIncludedProcesse: Oil reservoir extraction treatment separation refers to the mixture extracted from underground oil and gas reservoirs, and after a series of treatment and separation processes, the oil, gas and water components are separated for further processing and use of gas-liquid separation: gas-liquid separation technology includes gravity separation, pressure separation, membrane separation and other ways. Common separation equipment includes gas-liquid separator, membrane separation device, etc. Chemical treatment: Chemical treatment technology requires the selection of appropriate treatment agents and reaction conditions according to the composition and nature of the mixture, and the target components in the mixture are separated by chemical reaction. Oil, gas and water separation: common separation equipment includes three-phase separator, cyclone, centrifugal separator, etc., by adjusting the operating parameters of the separation equipment, such as pressure, temperature and flow rate, to achieve effective separation of oil, gas and water.

油藏提取处理分离是指从地下油气藏中开采出来的混合物，经过一系列的处理和分离工艺，将其中的油、气和水等组分分离出来，以便进一步加工利用气液分离：气液分离技术包括重力分离、压力分离、膜分离等多种方式。常见的分离设备包括气液分离器、膜分离装置等。化学处理：化学处理技术需要根据混合物的组成和性质选择适当的处理剂和反应条件，通过化学反应将混合物中的目标组分分离出来。油气水分离：常见的分离设备包括三相分离器、旋流器、离心分离器等，通过调整分离设备的操作参数，如压力、温度和流速等，实现油、气、水的有效分离。
technology.technologicalApplicability: This process pertains to the extraction, treatment, and separation of oil in the Permian Basin, specifically from the San Andres dolomite. It is utilized in the petroleum industry for enhanced oil recovery operations, including waterflooding and CO2 injection at depths typical for this region, with associated gas processing for component separation and CO2 re-injection for long-term storage.
该过程涉及二叠纪盆地、特别是圣安德烈斯白云岩的石油提取、处理与分离。它在石油行业中用于增强油气回收操作，包括在该地区典型深度的注水和二氧化碳注入，以及伴生气体处理以用于组分分离和长期储存的二氧化碳再注入。

referenceToDataSource.common:shortDescription: Aycaguer, A.-C., Lev-On, M., & Winer, A. M. (2001). Reducing Carbon Dioxide Emissions with Enhanced Oil Recovery Projects: A Life Cycle Assessment Approach. Energy & Fuels, 15(2), 303–308.
Aycaguer, A.-C., Lev-On, M., & Winer, A. M. (2001). Reducing Carbon Dioxide Emissions with Enhanced Oil Recovery Projects: A Life Cycle Assessment Approach. Energy & Fuels, 15(2), 303–308.

dataSourcesTreatmentAndRepresentativenes.useAdviceForDataSet: The lifecycle assessment data is delimited to the operational boundary of the facility and specifically focuses on greenhouse gas emissions during the enhanced oil recovery production. When using this data set, users must include all emissions and discharges related to the extraction and processing stages. The transport and injection of CO2 for additional oil extraction and storage must also be accounted for. It's important to maintain the minimum miscibility pressure for CO2 injection as per the study. This data should not be used to assess the entire lifecycle impacts of oil production, as it is limited to certain emissions and processes.
该生命周期评估数据限定在设施的运营边界内，重点关注增强油气回收生产期间的温室气体排放。使用这些数据时，用户必须包括与提取和处理阶段相关的所有排放和排放物。还必须核算为额外的石油开采和储存而进行的二氧化碳的运输和注入。按照研究的要求，必须维持二氧化碳注入的最低混溶压力。该数据不应用于评估石油生产的整个生命周期影响，因为它仅限于某些排放和过程。

review.common:reviewDetails: Inventory: The internal review was done by several iteration steps concerning raw data validation, raw data documentation, representativity, completeness and consistency of modelling with regard to ISO 14040 and 14044.
清单： 内部审查通过几个迭代步骤完成，涉及原始数据验证、原始数据记录、代表性、完整性、与 ISO 14040 和 14044 有关的建模的一致性。

publicationAndOwnership.common:licenseType: Free of charge for all users and uses

exchange.generalComment: Oil production, gas density of 0.8 tons/1000 cubic meters and calorific value of 1000 BTU/scf
生产石油量,气体密度为0.8吨/1000立方米和热值为1000 BTU/scf
